Approximately 30% of humans are nasally colonized by <em>S. aureus, which represents a significant risk factor for invasive infections . As a pathogen, <em >S.Aureus expresses a vast repertoire of cell surface adhesins, secreted toxins, and tissue-degrading enzymes .

Study suggests MSSA strain UAMS-1 may have altered metabolism relative to ground-control cultures of S. aureus . Analysis of data suggests that spaceflight samples may have increased amino acid metabolism .

RNA-Seq samples that showed statistically significant differences in relative abundance ( > 2-fold change) were subjected to hierarchical clustering analysis . The analysis indicated robust clustering among biological replicates within each experimental group .

Eight of the nine genes and proteins overlapping between the RNA-Seq and secretomics datasets were primarily annotated as intracellular proteins . The lone extracellular protein in this dataset, EsxA, is secreted by the Type VII-like Ess secretion system .

The study examined how aspects of S. aureus physiology and virulence were affected by spaceflight conditions in spaceflight . The study was conducted using RNA-Seq and secretomics .
The Fisher exact test is indicated . Pathpath enrichments for each dataset (RNA-Seq, proteomics), as well as the combined datasets are indicated .

S. aureus is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of environments and adjust its metabolism accordingly . Expression patterns of metabolic genes and proteins in spaceflight suggested that these . cultures may have experienced an altered metabolic state compared to ground control cultures .
BRIC-23 FLT cultures may have grown to higher cell densities compared to GC cultures . FLT culture growth curve was not conducted in the actual BRIC23 flight and ground control experiments .

Altered levels of metabolites, genes and/or proteins related to arginine metabolism were also observed in spaceflight samples relative to ground controls . These changes could reflect an overall increase in urea cycle activity in response to acid stress . Increased acid production has also been demonstrated in <em>S. aureus biofilms .
The BRIC-23 flight (FLT) experiment is outlined in Fig. 5 . The study is based on analyzed RNA-Seq, proteomics, secretomics, and metabolomics data presented in this study .

All analyzed fractions were merged before the analysis .

The data were normalized by sum and subjected to log transformation and auto-scaling . Categories of genes/proteins identified by RNA-Seq, proteomics, and secretomics as being statistically significant . Categories were assigned using manual curation based on gene annotation and/or predicted function .

RNA-Seq, cellular proteomics, and/or secretomics DE data were analyzed using Paint-omics version 3 and STRING version 11.5 . NCBI MRSA252 genome (Genbank #) was used as a reference in both analyses .
